intro: Grumilea sycophylla, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain seeds. It is often found in sandy soils and is well adapted to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Australia. Grumilea sycophylla is also the floral emblem of Australia, symbolizing the country's natural beauty and resilience.
